data.name: AbilitiesWindow_ActionTextBox
data.value: Trigger for activating this ability.

data.name: AbilitiesWindow_LevelUpDown
data.value: Level required for learning this ability.

data.name: AbilitiesWindow_NameComboBox
data.value: Every ability probably has a name.

data.name: AbilitiesWindow_NotesTextBox
data.value: Any extra information describing the ability.

data.name: AbilitiesWindow_RecoveryTextBox
data.value: How to replenish uses for this ability.

data.name: AbilitiesWindow_TypeComboBox
data.value: Which category list this ability comes from.

data.name: AbilitiesWindow_UsesTextBox
data.value: Amount of times this ability can be used before it is exhausted.

data.name: Ammunition
data.value: Resources\Json\Ammunition.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089

data.name: AmmunitionWindow_BonusTextBox
data.value: Add any extra damage, status effects, or behaviours here.

data.name: AmmunitionWindow_CoinTypeComboBox
data.value: Specify the denomination so you don't have to worry about math.

data.name: AmmunitionWindow_DamageTypeComboBox
data.value: Set the type of wound this projectile will cause.

data.name: AmmunitionWindow_NameComboBox
data.value: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack.

data.name: AmmunitionWindow_QuantityUpDown
data.value: At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

data.name: AmmunitionWindow_UsedUpDown
data.value: Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition.

data.name: AmmunitionWindow_ValueUpDown
data.value: The worth of 1 piece of this ammunition type.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_AgeUpDown
data.value: A character should be older than 0, and probably at least the age of majority for their race.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_DistinguishingMarksTextBox
data.value: Give the character an unusual or memorable physical characteristic. Such as a scar, limp, or tattoo.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_EyeColourTextBox
data.value: Select a distinctive eye colour.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_FeetUpDown
data.value: A stong and tough character might be tall or just heavy.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_GenderComboBox
data.value: Male, female, or even 'other' characters don't gain any special benifits or hindrances.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_HairColourTextBox
data.value: Choose an interesting hair colour.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_InchesUpDown
data.value: A stong and tough character might be tall or just heavy.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_SkinColourTextBox
data.value: Select a reasonable skin colour. Or don't. I'm just text, I can't stop you.

data.name: AppearanceWindow_WeightUpDown
data.value: A weak but agile character might be thin.

data.name: ArmorWindow_ArmorClassUpDown
data.value: The armor's base AC without any modifiers added.

data.name: ArmorWindow_EquipedTextBox
data.value: Armor might have a snazzy title.

data.name: ArmorWindow_MagicArmorClassUpDown
data.value: Total of any magic bonuses that affect Armor Class.

data.name: ArmorWindow_MiscArmorClassUpDown
data.value: Total of any status bonuses that affect Armor Class.

data.name: ArmorWindow_ShieldArmorClassUpDown
data.value: Weilding a shield normally increases AC by 2.

data.name: ArmorWindow_ShieldTextBox
data.value: Usually made from wood or metal and carried in one hand.

data.name: ArmorWindow_ShieldWeightUpDown
data.value: Generally weighs more than 0.

data.name: ArmorWindow_StealthComboBox
data.value: Determines if the wearer has disadvantage on stealth checks.

data.name: ArmorWindow_StrengthUpDown
data.value: Armor reduces speed by 10 unless the strength score is equal to or greater than listed score.

data.name: ArmorWindow_TypeComboBox
data.value: Light, Medium, or Heavy armor.

data.name: ArmorWindow_WeightUpDown
data.value: Contrary to popular belief, heavy armor will weigh more.

data.name: AttacksWindow_AbilityComboBox
data.value: Most weapons require strength to use, but finesse weapons allow a character to use their dexterity score. Special weapons or statuses might allow other abilities to be used instead.

data.name: AttacksWindow_AttackComboBox
data.value: Your race, class, and feats can grant you proficiency with certain weapons or categories of weapons.

data.name: AttacksWindow_CoinTypeComboBox
data.value: Specify the denomination so you don't have to worry about math.

data.name: AttacksWindow_DamageTextBox
data.value: List the damage rolls and proficiency bonus to attacking with this weapon.

data.name: AttacksWindow_DamageTypeComboBox
data.value: Some creatures and objects are exceedingly difficult or unusually easy to hurt with certain types of damage.

data.name: AttacksWindow_IgnoreWeightCheckBox
data.value: This is generally used to 'place' the weapon in a bag of holding.

data.name: AttacksWindow_MiscDamageTextBox
data.value: Here, you can use my plus 1 mace.

data.name: AttacksWindow_NotesTextBox
data.value: Many weapons have special properties related to their use, as shown in the Weapons table.

data.name: AttacksWindow_ProficencyOverrideCheckBox
data.value: Force this weapon to add your character's proficiency bonus.

data.name: AttacksWindow_RangeTextBox
data.value: How far you can strike enemies with this weapon. Ranged weapons have minimum and maximum effective ranges.

data.name: AttacksWindow_TypeComboBox
data.value: Specifying the type of weapon allows Concierge to automatically attempt to calculate proficiency bonuses. Most people can use simple weapons with proficiency, however, martial weapons require more specialized training to use effectively.

data.name: AttacksWindow_ValueUpDown
data.value: The worth of this weapon. Even your fists have value to someone.

data.name: AttacksWindow_WeightUpDown
data.value: Bro, do you even lift?

data.name: AttributesWindow_CharismaUpDown
data.value: Measures: Confidence, eloquence, leadership. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: AttributesWindow_ConstitutionUpDown
data.value: Measures: Health, stamina, vital force. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: AttributesWindow_DexterityUpDown
data.value: Measures: Physical agility, reflexes, balance, poise. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: AttributesWindow_IntelligenceUpDown
data.value: Measures: Mental acuity, information recall, analytical skill. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: AttributesWindow_StrengthUpDown
data.value: Measures: Natural athleticism, bodily power. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: AttributesWindow_WisdomUpDown
data.value: Measures: Awareness, intuition, insight. Maximum of 30, but cannot be raised above 20 without special traits or equipment.

data.name: ClassResourceWindow_NotesTextBox
data.value: Any extra information to help Danial so he remembers to rage.

data.name: ClassResourceWindow_PoolUpDown
data.value: Maximum available resources.

data.name: ClassResourceWindow_RecoveryComboBox
data.value: How fast can your character recover their spent resources.

data.name: ClassResourceWindow_ResourceNameComboBox
data.value: Not every class has resources to spend. Only the cool ones.

data.name: ClassResourceWindow_SpentUpDown
data.value: Currently used resources.

data.value: Resources\Images\ColorPickerBackground.png;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089

data.name: CompanionWindow_AcUpDown
data.value: Total Armor Class of the companion.

data.name: CompanionWindow_CreatureSizeComboBox
data.value: In Soviet Russia, companion ride you.

data.name: CompanionWindow_InitiativeUpDown
data.value: Total initiative score for the companion.

data.name: CompanionWindow_MovementUpDown
data.value: Total movement speed for the companion.

data.name: CompanionWindow_NameTextBox
data.value: For example, an albino owl might be called "Al".

data.name: CompanionWindow_PerceptionUpDown
data.value: Total score to a companion's awareness.

data.name: CompanionWindow_VisionComboBox
data.value: Visual traits granted to the companion.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_BlindedCheckBox
data.value: Automatically fail any ability checks. Attack rolls against your character have advantage, your attacks have disadvantage.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_CharmedCheckBox
data.value: Your character cannot attack the charmer. The charmer has advantage on ability checks when interacting socially.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_DeafenedCheckBox
data.value: Your character cannot hear and automatically fails any ability check that requires hearing.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_DeathCheckBox
data.value: Your character must succeed on 3 death saving throws, before failing 3. Succeeding will stabilize at 0 HP.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_EncumbranceCheckBox
data.value: Override the automatically calculated encumbrance status.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_EncumbranceComboBox
data.value: A carry weight exceeding 5 and 10 times Strength will reduce speed by 10 and 20 respectively.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_FatiguedComboBox
data.value: Some special abilities and environmental hazards, such as starvation and the long-term effects of freezing or scorching temperatures, can lead to exhaustion. Exhaustion is measured in six levels.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_FrightenedCheckBox
data.value: Your character has disadvantage on Ability Checks and Attack rolls while the source of fear is within line of sight. You can’t willingly move closer to the source.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_GrappledCheckBox
data.value: Your character speed becomes 0. It ends when the grappler is incapacitated or you are thrown away.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_IncapacitatedCheckBox
data.value: Your character cannot react or take an action.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_InvisibleCheckBox
data.value: You are impossible to see without the aid of magic or a Special sense. Attacks against you have disadvantage, your attacks have advantage.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_ParalyzedCheckBox
data.value: Your character is incapacitated and automatically fail Strength and Dexterity Saving Throws. Attacks have advantage, and melee are auto crit.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_PetrifiedCheckBox
data.value: Transforms your character into an inanimate substance and are incapacitated. Resistant to all damage and immune to poison and disease.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_PoisonedCheckBox
data.value: You have disadvantage on Attack rolls and Ability Checks

data.name: ConditionsWindow_ProneCheckBox
data.value: Your only movement option is to crawl like a little bitch and have disadvantage on attacks. Melee attack is advantage, ranged is disadvantage.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_RestrainedCheckBox
data.value: Your speed becomes 0. Your attacks have disadvantage, enemies have advantage. Dexterity Saving Throws are disadvantage.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_StunnedCheckBox
data.value: You are incapacitated and speak falteringly, and automatically fail Strength and Dexterity Saving Throws. Attacks against have advantage.

data.name: ConditionsWindow_UnconsciousCheckBox
data.value: Your character is incapacitated, drop what you're holding, and fall prone. Attacks against have advantage and hits are auto crit.

data.name: EquipmentWindow_ItemComboBox
data.value: This item will be removed from your inventory to this page.

data.name: EquipmentWindow_SlotComboBox
data.value: Choose a location to equip the item to your character.

data.name: InventoryWindow_AttunedCheckBox
data.value: Spend time attuning to this item, allowing the use of special abilities. Your character can only attune to 3 items at a time.

data.name: InventoryWindow_CoinTypeComboBox
data.value: Specify the denomination so you don't have to worry about math.

data.name: InventoryWindow_DescriptionTextBox
data.value: Describe, in detail, why your character looted this item.

data.name: InventoryWindow_IgnoreWeightCheckBox
data.value: This is generally used to 'place' the item in a bag of holding.

data.value: The worth of this item. Lisa, I'd like to buy your rock.

data.name: InventoryWindow_WeightUpDown
data.value: Is this item portable or luggable?

data.name: JournalWindow_DocumentTextBox
data.value: When we last left our heroes, Sir Schmoopy and Eluamus Nailo were searching for a magical herb to cure Schmoopy's dying grandmother...

data.name: LanguagesWindow_NameComboBox
data.value: Race indicates the languages a character can speak by default, and a background might give access to one or more additional languages.

data.name: LanguagesWindow_ScriptTextBox
data.value: The style of characters are used to write this language. Some languages are only spoken, and may not have a unique script.

data.name: LanguagesWindow_SpeakersTextBox
data.value: The races that are likely to speak a given language.

data.name: PersonalityWindow_BondTextBox
data.value: Bonds represent a character's connections to people, places, and events in the world.

data.name: PersonalityWindow_FlawTextBox
data.value: Character flaws represent some vice, compulsion, fear, or weakness. Anything that someone else could exploit to cause you to act against your best interests.

data.name: PersonalityWindow_IdealTextBox
data.value: Ideals are things that you believe in most strongly, the fundamental moral and ethical principles that compel you to act as you do.

data.name: PersonalityWindow_NotesTextBox
data.value: Extra descriptions about a character's history.

data.name: PersonalityWindow_Trait1TextBox
data.value: They should be self-descriptions that are specific about what makes a character stand out.

data.name: PersonalityWindow_Trait2TextBox
data.value: They should be self-descriptions that are specific about what makes a character stand out.

data.value: A character can be proficient in armors, weapons, or tools.

data.value: The name of the armors, weapons, or tools that a characters is proficient in.

data.name: SensesWindow_InspirationCheckBox
data.value: Determins if the player can roll an insperation die.

data.name: SensesWindow_MovementBonusUpDown

data.name: StatusEffectsWindow_DescriptionTextBox
data.value: Resistance and then vulnerability are applied after all other modifiers to damage. Multiple instances of resistance or vulnerability that affect the same damage type count as only one instance.

data.name: StatusEffectsWindow_NameComboBox
data.value: Some creatures and objects are exceedingly difficult or unusually easy to hurt with certain types of damage.

data.name: StatusEffectsWindow_TypeComboBox
data.value: Having resistance to a damage type, damage of that type is halved against it. If a creature or an object has vulnerability to a damage type, damage of that type is doubled against it.

data.name: Subclass
data.value: Resources\Json\Subclass.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089

data.value: Resources\Constants\Tool.txt;System.String, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089;utf-8

data.name: WealthWindow_AddRadioButton
data.value: Money can be exchanged for goods and services.

data.name: WealthWindow_AmountUpDown
data.value: Wealth appears in many forms in the world. Coins, gemstones, trade goods, art objects, animals, and property can reflect your character’s financial well-being.

data.name: WealthWindow_CpRadioButton
data.value: One silver piece is worth ten copper pieces, which are common among laborers and beggars. A single copper piece buys a candle, a torch, or a piece of chalk.

data.name: WealthWindow_EpRadioButton
data.value: The electrum piece originates from fallen empires and lost kingdoms, and they sometimes arouse suspicion and skepticism when used in transactions. An electrum piece is worth five silver pieces.

data.name: WealthWindow_GpRadioButton
data.value: With one gold piece, a character can buy a bedroll or 50 feet of good rope. A skilled artisan can earn one gold piece a day. The gold piece is the standard unit of measure for wealth, even if the coin itself is not commonly used.

data.name: WealthWindow_PpRadioButton
data.value: The platinum piece originates from fallen empires and lost kingdoms, and they sometimes arouse suspicion and skepticism when used in transactions. A platinum piece is worth ten gold pieces.

data.name: WealthWindow_SpRadioButton
data.value: One gold piece is worth ten silver pieces, the most prevalent coin among commoners. A silver piece buys a laborer's work for half a day, a flask of lamp oil, or a night's rest in a poor inn.

data.name: WealthWindow_SubtractRadioButton
data.value: Why couldn't I have 3 money and no kids?

data.name: Weapon
data.value: Resources\Json\Weapon.json;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089
